tabs.label: Rajya Sabha
tabs.title: Rajya Sabha - Council of States (Art 80)

sections.heading: Constitutional Provision
points: **Art 80**: RS shall consist of 250 members (233 elected + 12 nominated + 5 UT - but currently 245)
**Permanent House**: Never dissolves; 1/3rd members retire every 2 years
**Represents States**: Federal character; Each state gets seats based on population
**Indirect Election**: Elected by State Legislative Assemblies using STV (proportional representation)
**Qualifications (Art 84)**: Indian citizen, 30+ years, no office of profit

sections.heading: Composition & Representation
points: **Total Strength**: 245 members (as of 2023)
**Elected Members (233)**: States 229, Union Territories 4 (Delhi, Puducherry, J&K, Ladakh)
**Nominated Members (12)**: Experts in Art, Literature, Science, Social Service (President nominates)
**State-wise allocation**: UP 31 (highest), Maharashtra 19, Tamil Nadu 18; Sikkim 1 (lowest)
**States with <4 members**: Get 1 seat (eg: Goa, Sikkim, Tripura, Meghalaya)

sections.heading: Chairman & Deputy Chairman
points: **Chairman**: Vice President of India (Art 64) - *ex-officio*, not a member of RS
**Deputy Chairman**: Elected by RS members from amongst themselves (Art 89)
**Chairman's Powers**: Presides over RS, maintains order, decides points of order, casting vote in tie
**Removal of Deputy Chairman**: By effective majority of RS (simple resolution)
**Acting Chairman**: When Chairman acts as President (Art 65), Deputy Chairman presides RS

sections.heading: Powers & Functions
points: **Legislative**: Can initiate any bill except Money Bills; Can delay Ordinary Bill by max 6 months
**Financial**: Can recommend amendments to Money Bills (not binding); LS can accept/reject; 14 days delay max
**Executive**: Can discuss executive actions; Ministers accountable to both Houses
**Electoral**: Elects Vice President (along with LS); Participates in Presidential election
**Judicial**: Participates in impeachment of President, removal of VP, Judges, CAG, CEC

sections.heading: Exclusive Powers of RS
points: **Art 249**: Can authorize Parliament to legislate on State List subjects (National interest) - Needs 2/3rd of members present & voting
**Art 312**: Can create new All India Services (IAS, IPS, IFS type) - Needs 2/3rd majority
**Removal of VP**: RS initiates resolution for removal of VP (Art 67b); LS must agree
**Elder House**: Acts as 'House of Elders' with experienced members; Provides mature deliberation
**Federal Guardian**: Protects states' interests in legislation

sections.heading: Limitations & Exam Tips
points: **Not Equal to LS**: Despite being Upper House, less powerful than LS (unlike US Senate = House of Representatives)
**No Money Bill Power**: Cannot initiate, reject, or amend Money Bills
**No Control over Executive**: Council of Ministers responsible ONLY to LS (Art 75(3)); No-confidence motion only in LS
**6-month delay**: Can delay Ordinary Bill by max 6 months (sends back with amendments; if LS passes again, RS must pass within 2 months)
**Important Cases**: None landmark; But RS role in Art 249, 312 asked in exams

tabs.summary: RS is a permanent federal chamber representing states with 245 members (233 elected by State Assemblies + 12 nominated). Chaired by VP. Has exclusive powers under Art 249 (State List legislation) & Art 312 (All India Services). Less powerful than LS - can delay bills but not reject; no Money Bill or no-confidence powers.

tabs.label: Lok Sabha
tabs.title: Lok Sabha - House of the People (Art 81)

sections.heading: Constitutional Provision
points: **Art 81**: LS shall consist of max 552 members (530 States + 20 UTs + 2 nominated Anglo-Indians)
**Direct Election**: Elected by people of India using FPTP (First Past The Post) system
**5-year term**: Normal term; Can be dissolved before 5 years; Extended during Emergency
**Popular Sovereignty**: Represents will of the people; More powerful than RS
**Qualifications (Art 84)**: Indian citizen, 25+ years, no office of profit

sections.heading: Composition & Representation
points: **Total Strength**: 543 members (as of 2019) - 530 States + 13 UTs
**State-wise allocation**: UP 80 (highest), Maharashtra 48, West Bengal 42, Bihar 40; Sikkim, Mizoram 1 (lowest)
**UT Representatives**: Delhi 7, J&K 5, Puducherry 1, etc.
**Nominated Members**: 2 Anglo-Indians (by President) - **Lapsed after 104th Amendment 2020**
**Reserved Seats**: 84 SC, 47 ST (as per population); Rotated every delimitation

sections.heading: Speaker & Deputy Speaker
points: **Speaker (Art 93)**: Elected by LS from amongst its members; Usually from ruling party
**Deputy Speaker (Art 93)**: Elected by LS; Usually from opposition (convention)
**Speaker's Powers**: Presides over LS, final authority on Money Bill (Art 110(3)), decides disqualification under 10th Schedule
**Casting Vote**: Speaker votes only in case of tie (Art 100(1))
**Removal**: By effective majority of LS (resolution with 14 days notice) - Art 94

sections.heading: Powers & Functions
points: **Legislative**: Can initiate any bill including Money Bills; Final say on legislation
**Financial**: Exclusive power over Money Bills (Art 110); Budget must be passed by LS; Grants voted by LS
**Executive Control**: Council of Ministers collectively responsible ONLY to LS (Art 75(3)); No-confidence motion only in LS
**Electoral**: Elects President (along with RS & State Assemblies), VP (with RS), Speaker, Deputy Speaker
**Judicial**: Participates in impeachment of President, removal of Judges, CAG, CEC, etc.

sections.heading: Exclusive Powers of LS
points: **Money Bills (Art 110)**: Only LS can originate Money Bills; RS can recommend (not binding); 14 days delay max
**No-confidence Motion (Art 75(3))**: Only LS can move no-confidence against Council of Ministers; If passed, govt must resign
**Budget & Grants**: Budget introduced in LS; Demands for Grants voted by LS; RS can only recommend
**Deadlock Resolution**: Joint Sitting called by President - LS will prevail due to larger strength (543 vs 245)
**Financial Bills**: All Financial Bills (Type I & II) must originate in LS

sections.heading: Dissolution & Emergency
points: **Dissolution**: President can dissolve LS before 5 years on PM's advice; After no-confidence; After general election
**During Emergency (Art 352)**: Term can be extended by 1 year at a time; Max 1 year after Emergency ends (Art 83(2))
**Prorogation vs Dissolution**: Prorogation = end of session (both Houses); Dissolution = end of LS term (only LS)
**Dissolution effects**: All pending bills in LS lapse (except bills pending in RS, or bills passed by LS awaiting RS approval)
**Post-dissolution**: President can summon LS within 6 months of dissolution (for Budget session)

sections.heading: Exam Important Points
points: **Most Powerful**: LS is supreme - Controls executive (PM + Council responsible only to LS), Controls finance (Money Bills)
**Speaker's Neutrality**: After election, Speaker resigns from party; Maintains impartiality; Has casting vote
**Delimitation**: Last done in 2008 (based on 2001 census); Frozen till 2026 (42nd Amendment); Now extended to 2031 (104th Amendment)
**Anti-Defection**: Speaker decides disqualification under 10th Schedule (not subject to judicial review till decision made)
**Joint Sitting**: LS dominates due to strength (543 vs 245) - Conducted by LS Speaker

tabs.summary: LS is the directly elected popular chamber with 543 members (530 States + 13 UTs) serving 5-year terms. Presided by Speaker. Supreme legislative body - Exclusive power over Money Bills, no-confidence motion, and financial matters. Council of Ministers responsible ONLY to LS. More powerful than RS in all matters.

data.summary: Indian Parliament (Art 79) = President + Rajya Sabha + Lok Sabha. Bicameral legislature with LS (543 members, 5-year term, directly elected) more powerful than RS (245 members, permanent, indirectly elected). LS controls Money Bills & executive; RS can delay bills but not reject. Both equal in President's impeachment, Constitutional Amendments.
